view

Class ProfileController

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.ProfileController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable, MenuButtons

    public class ProfileController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, MenuButtons
    The controller for the profile pane. This pane displays the information pertinent to the current logged in user, such as their hiking history and profile picture. The class fetches the current logged in user from the LoginController. The user can also update their username and password on this pane.
    Author:
    Nick Broome

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL arg0,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle arg1)
        This method initializes the profile pane. It takes the current logged in user's hiking history and displays it in a listview. If the user is an admin, then they will see the extra buttons only shown to an admin, otherwise they will not.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

      • updateProfile

        public void updateProfile(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Upon clicking the button, whatever is entered in the username and password field will be taken and used to replace/update the loggedInUser's information. It then refreshes the page.
        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • handleTrailBtn

        public void handleTrailBtn(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method and those below it all function nearly the same, with handling the event of a user clicking on one of the buttons in the menu AnchorPane. Depending on the button pressed, various actions will be accomplished in the app. handleUserListBtn, handleBackup, and handleRestore are exclusive to the admins.
        Specified by:
        handleTrailBtn in interface MenuButtons
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
